label: Description
value: Chinese export blue and white deep bowl, or basin. The central scene of the interior is painted in deep underglaze blue with European court ladies standing on a terrace strewn with flowers, each holding a floral sprig to smell while a servant to one side bears a basket of more flowers. The exterior is decorated with freely painted with floral sprigs.

label: Provenance
value: - 1973: Nijstad Antiquairs (Amsterdam); sold to Ralph M. Chait Gallery (New York). 1973-74: Ralph M. Chait Gallery (New York); sold to private collector (New York). 1974–1981: Private Collection (New York). 1981–2019: Private Collection (New York), by inheritance within the family; sold back to Ralph M. Chait Gallery (New York) 2020: Acquired by Cooper Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Charles E. Sampson Memorial Fund
